revision.text:
{{advert|date=May 2013}} {{Infobox company | company_name = Carahsoft Technology Corp. | foundation = 2004 | key_people = Craig P. Abod <small>([[CEO]]) & ([[President]])</small> | location = [[Reston, Virginia|Reston]], [[Virginia]], [[United States|U.S.]] | homepage = [http://www.carahsoft.com/ carahsoft.com] }}
'''Carahsoft Technology Corp.''' is a privately held company located in Reston, VA. The company is an [[information technology|IT]] solutions provider for Federal, state and local government agencies, and educational institutions. Carahsoft works with a vast ecosystem of manufacturers, resellers, and management consulting partners to provide these government customers with IT solutions that enable them to gather, share, and respond to vital information with increased agility and security. Founded in 2004, Carahsoft hit $1 billion in annual sales in December 2011, which marked the end of its 7th year.<ref>{{cite web|last=Amtower|first=Mark|title=My 2004 Predictions - and a 2012 Fed 100|url=http://blog.federaldirect.net/2012/02/my-2004-predictions-and-2012-fed-100.html|work=Selling to the Government: Amtower on B2G|publisher=Federal Direct|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref>
== IT Solutions == Carahsoft's IT solutions support data analysis and storage, cyber defense and security, business intelligence, HR management, and telework.<ref>{{cite web|title=Company Snapshot|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/businessweek/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=13625990|work=Bloomberg Businessweek|publisher=BLOOMBERG L.P.|accessdate=20 September 2011}}</ref> Carahsoft's vendors provide the government with IT solutions centered on emerging/strategic technologies, such as [[cloud computing]], business process management, citizen engagement, collaboration and social media, and [[geographic information systems]]. Many of these innovative solutions aid government organizations in modernizing their IT systems, as well as streamlining and simplifying agencies IT assets onto a secure central network.<ref>{{cite web|title=Carahsoft Leaps Ahead on 2011 Top 100|url=http://washingtontechnology.com/Articles/2011/07/05/Top-100-Carahsoft.aspx?s=wt100_010711&Page=1|work=Washington Technology|publisher=1105 Media, Inc.|accessdate=22 September 2011}}</ref>
Carahsoft is divided into specialized teams focused on providing the government with solutions that include Adobe, Storage, Open Source, VMware, Intelligence, SAP, F5 Networks and HP Software.<ref>{{cite web|title=Fairfax County Economic Development Authority|url=http://www.fairfaxcountyeda.org/companies/carahsoft|work=Fairfax County Company Profile|publisher=Fairfax County Economic Development Authority|accessdate=22 September 2011}}</ref>
== Contracts == As a [[General Services Administration|GSA]] Schedule holder on IT Schedule 70,<ref>{{cite web|first=GSA|title=Leading Contractors Reporting for SIN 132-33|url=http://www.gsaitcatalog.com/federal_it/ViewTopITContractor.asp?Show=30&table=132-33|work=GSA IT Catalog|publisher=Federal IT Publications|accessdate=16 September 2011}}</ref> Carahsoft serves as the government's largest partner and main aggregator for the majority of its top vendors.<ref>{{cite web|title=Carahsoft Technology Corp. Co. Profile|url=http://goliath.ecnext.com/coms2/product-compint-0001389185-page.html|work=Goliath Business Knowledge on Demand|publisher=The Gale Group, a part of Cengage Learning|accessdate=22 September 2011}}</ref> To expedite the [[procurement]] process, Carahsoft has acquired various contract vehicles, including state and local contracts, and federal contracts, which support the US Army, the Navy, the Department of Defense, the Department of US Revenue, [[Defense Information Systems Agency|DISA]], and the Airforce, as well as many other government organizations.<ref>{{cite web|title=Contracts|url=http://www.carahsoft.com/contracts/index.php#state|work=Carahsoft Solutions for Government|publisher=2011 Carahsoft|accessdate=22 September 2011}}</ref> On February 13, 2012, Carahsoft was awarded a contract by the National Cooperative Purchasing Association, offering public sector entities nationwide with the greatest overall government pricing for many of the top IT solutions Carahsoft provides through its vendors.<ref>{{cite web|title=Carahsoft Awarded National Cooperative Purchasing Association (NCPA) Contract|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/CarahsoftNCPA/2_2012/prweb9186609.htm|work=PRWeb|publisher=PRWeb|accessdate=23 May 2012}}</ref>
== Industry Recognition == Carahsoft has been recognized by its partners as a leading revenue producer, and is listed annually among the industry's fastest growing firms <ref>{{cite web|title=Industry Recognition: 2011 {{!}} 2010 {{!}} 2009|url=http://www.carahsoft.com/about/awards.php|work=Carahsoft Solutions for Government|publisher=Carahsoft|accessdate=26 September 2011}}</ref> by ''VAR Business'', ''CRN, Inc.<ref>{{cite web|title=CRN 2011 Fast Growth 100 Award Winners|url=http://www.crn.com/slide-shows/channel-programs/231900579/crn-2011-fast-growth-100-award-winners.htm?pgno=6|work=CRN|publisher=UMB Channel|accessdate=17 October 2011}}</ref>'', ''Washington Technology'', ''Inc. 5000 <ref>{{cite web|title=The 2011 Inc. 5000 List of America's Fastest Growing Companies|url=http://www.inc.com/inc5000/profile/carahsoft-technology|work=Inc.com|publisher=Mansueto Ventures LLC|accessdate=17 October 2011}}</ref>'', and ''Washington Business Journal <ref>{{cite web|title=The biggest of the fastest: Carahsoft Technology Corp.|url=http://www.carahsoft.com/pdf/WBJBiggestFastest2011.pdf|work=Washington Business Journal|publisher=American City Business Journals, Inc.|accessdate=17 October 2011}}</ref>'' and ''Washington Smart CEO Magazine''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Carahsoft Named Future 50 and Blue Chip Awards Winner by Washington SmartCEO Magazine|url=http://wn.com/carahsoft_named_future_50_and_blue_chip_awards_winner?query=Carahsoft+Future+50+Winner|work=Yahoo! News|publisher=2012 World News Inc.|accessdate=23 May 2012}}</ref> On April 3, 2012, Carahsoft announced that CEO Craig P. Abod had been recognized as one of the 2012 Federal 100 Award winners, which showcases 100 Government and industry leaders who have made a crucial impact on the federal government's acquisition, development and management of information technology.<ref>{{cite web|first=Chris|title=Carahsoft President Craig P. Abod Named to the 2012 Federal 100|url=http://technewsstories.com/carahsoft-president-craig-p-abod-named-to-the-2012-federal-100/|work=TechNewsStories.com|publisher=Alphabird, LLC|accessdate=29 May 2012}}</ref>
== Carahsoft Hosted Annual Events == Each year, Carahsoft's marketing team works with its vendors to host the following on-sight events:<ref>{{cite web|last=Zarley|first=Craig|title=2007 Fast Growth 100: Company Profiles|url=http://www.crn.com/news/channel-programs/200900359/2007-fast-growth-100-company-profiles.htm?pgno=1|work=CRN|publisher=UMB Channel|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref>
'''Government Big Data Forum''' - Best practices surrounding [[Big Data]] technology, trends, and issues.<ref>{{cite web|last=Gourley|first=Bob|title=Update on the 6 March 2012 Government Big Data Forum|url=http://ctovision.com/2012/02/update-on-the-6-march-2012-government-big-data-forum/|work=CTOVISION.COM|publisher=CRUCIAL POINT LLC|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Troiani|first=Gino|title=Carahsoft to Host Govt. Big Data Forum March 6|url=http://www.govconexecutive.com/2012/02/carahsoft-to-host-govt-big-data-forum-march-6/|work=GovConExecutive|publisher=Executive Mosaic LLC|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref>
'''HP Software Government Summit''' - Covers a trend in Government IT relating to HP’s information management, security, operations and applications solutions.<ref>{{cite web|last=Admin|title=Carahsoft Hosts 2nd Annual HP Government Summit, May 2-3, 2012 in Washington D.C.|url=http://votencmentalhealth.info/carahsoft-hosts-2nd-annual-hp-government-summit-may-2-3-2012-in-washington-d-c.html|work=Vote NC Mental Health|publisher=Vote NC Mental Health|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref>
'''Symantec Government Technology Summit''' - An outline for government agencies to enforce to create a secure IT infrastructure encompassing Symantec’s Mobile Management and Security, Symantec Endpoint Protection, Data Loss Prevention, and Gideon solutions.<ref>{{cite web|last=Klingbail|first=Jaimie|title=Symantec Government Technology Summit 2011|url=http://www.govloop.com/events/symantec-government-technology|work=GovLoop Events|publisher=GovLoop|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Carahsoft Hosts 5th Annual Symantec Government Technology Summit on March 20, 2012|url=http://www.allvoices.com/news/11573138-carahsoft-hosts-5th-annual-symantec-government-technology-summit-on-march-20-2012|work=Allvoices|publisher=Allvoices|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref>
'''Adobe Government Technology Summit''' - An emphasis on the various features of Adobe products and services, and how these applications are employed to resolve ongoing issues within government agencies.<ref>{{cite web|title=Adobe Government Technology Summit|url=http://www.allconferences.com/conferences/2010/20100416132910/|work=AllConferences.com|publisher=AllConferences.com|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Carahsoft Hosts 2nd Annual HP Government Summit, May 2-3, 2012 in Washington D.C.|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/HPGovSummit2012/CarahsoftEvent/prweb9385773.htm|work=PRWeb|publisher=PRWeb|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref>
'''Citizen Engagement Seminar''' - Insight into how government agencies are utilizing new media technologies to overcome communication challenges and successfully engage citizens.<ref>{{cite web|title=Second Annual Citizen Engagement Seminar|url=http://www.govevents.com/details/6086/second-annual-citizen-engagement-seminar|work=GovEvents|publisher=GovEvents, LLC|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref>
'''VMware Federal Technical Conference''' - A federal end-user event showcasing how VMware’s latest [[virtualization]] solutions provide support to federal agencies within all facets of the government.<ref>{{cite web|title=VMware’s 3rd Annual Federal Technical Conference in DC|url=http://www.securityorb.com/2010/06/vmware%E2%80%99s-3rd-annual-federal-technical-conference-in-dc/|work=SecurityOrb|publisher=SecurityOrb|accessdate=22 May 2012}}</ref>
